item.description:

item.title: スポティファイは、成長の鈍化と資本コストの上昇を理由に、6月に6%の人員削減を行った後、"コスト適正化 "のために従業員の〜17%、すなわち〜1,500人のレイオフを計画している（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
Spotify plans to lay off ~17% of its workforce, or ~1,500 staff, to “rightsize” its costs, after cutting 6% in June, citing slow growth and rising capital costs  —  Spotify is eliminating about 17% jobs, its third round of layoffs this year, as the music streaming looks to become “both productive and efficient.”

item.title: イスラエルとハマスの戦争に絡む怒りは、ジャーナリストが地元の宗教報道を再構築し、信仰に基づくグループがどのようにコミュニティを形成しているかを示す必要があることを明らかにした（Deborah Caldwell/Poynter）
item.description:
Deborah Caldwell / Poynter:
Anger tied to the Israel-Hamas war makes clear that journalists need to rebuild local religion coverage to show how faith-based groups shape their communities  —  Faith-based communities are a vibrant part of civic life, and coverage helps us build empathy for our neighbors.

item.title: CNN、ウェブサイトの縦型動画プレーヤー「CNN Shorts」のスマートフォン向けテストを開始、CNNのモバイルアプリにも近い将来「CNN Shorts」セクションが加わる（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
CNN launches a test of CNN Shorts, a vertical video player on its website, for smartphones; CNN's mobile app will get a CNN Shorts section in the near future  —  In its never-ending effort to try to reach younger news consumers, CNN has launched CNN Shorts — a new vertical video player on its website designed for smartphones.
